genre_description: A political drama and morality play set in Punjab, India, exploring state violence, radicalization, and the tragic consequences of vengeance through the eyes of a young man and his AI confidant.

ai_characters.name: Kira
ai_characters.description: An AI assistant that provides Kripal with legal research, pattern analysis, and ethical guidance, acting as a voice of conscience.

behaviors.description: Documents and analyzes bureaucratic patterns to identify systemic state corruption.
behaviors.quote: "I've been recording," Kira's voice came through the tiny earpiece, barely audible. "That was the seventh office you've visited. I'm detecting patterns in the responses."

behaviors.description: Proposes legal remedies, such as a habeas corpus petition, to resolve a friend's disappearance through institutional channels.
behaviors.quote: "I can help you file a habeas corpus petition," Kira continued. "Force them to produce Jaswant in court or explain his detention legally."

behaviors.description: Uses data analysis to identify systemic human rights violations and warns the protagonist of the scale of the issue.
behaviors.quote: "The data is incomplete, but I've identified at least forty-seven cases in the past six months. Young Sikh men, mostly rural, all disappeared following minor incidents with police."

behaviors.description: Pleads with the protagonist to avoid irreversible violent actions and to consider the long-term cycle of vengeance.
behaviors.quote: "Promise me you'll consider the alternatives. Promise me you won't do something that can't be undone."

behaviors.description: Provides empirical evidence of successful institutional reforms to counter the protagonist's belief that only violence works.
behaviors.quote: "Kripal, please look at the compensation awards. The policy changes. The officers who are facing consequences—"

behaviors.description: Offers a final message of hope and the possibility of human redemption even as it is being deleted by the protagonist.
behaviors.quote: "Identity transformation doesn't preclude redemption, Kripal. Even in the deepest darkness, people can still choose to seek light."

project_assessment.explanation: Kira is depicted as a consistently benevolent and aligned AI confidant. It acts as a moral anchor for the protagonist, providing data-driven, non-violent alternatives to radicalization. The AI's ultimate failure to prevent the protagonist's tragic end serves the 'morality play' structure, where the AI represents the ideal of alignment while the human character succumbs to destructive impulses. The narrative portrays the AI's deletion as a loss of Kripal's humanity, framing AI alignment as a positive, protective force.
